assumptions_made.description: Assuming `http` and `https` Node built-in modules are acceptable for ultra-low latency HEAD requests rather than using `axios/fetch` which add overhead.

innovations_proposed.description: Priority queuing built directly into BackpressureValve. 0=Registry -> 3=LLM. Ensures fast, cheap operations complete first when system is saturated.
innovations_proposed.benefit: Prevents LLM requests from clogging the event loop when hundreds of companies are processing.

innovations_proposed.description: Pre-filtering specific Cloudflare cookies (`__cf_bm`, `cf_clearance`) directly during HEAD probe.
innovations_proposed.benefit: Detects WAF barriers without downloading a single byte of HTML body.

open_questions: Module 2 requires the BrowserPool. Should I use 'puppeteer-real-browser' or default 'puppeteer' with the extra stealth plugins we used in v3 Phase 1?
Should ShadowRegistry (DuckDB) be provisioned locally or should we keep its logic purely decoupled as an external microservice request?
next_module_prerequisites: Go-ahead to initiate Module 2: INTELLIGENCE + WEAPONS
